Text: The Biden Administration must not be weak and it must act with determined resolve to enforce sanctions. Finally, it must do everything it can to get every American citizen out of harm’s way as quickly as possible.

Vladimir Putin is attacking Ukraine to oppress the free people who live there and to take their country from them. The consequences for this invasion must be swift and I stand ready to support harsh sanctions on Putin and his officials for this attack.

Congressman Jim Hagedorn sadly passed away this morning after his battle with kidney cancer. He cared deeply about his family, Minnesota, and the country. My prayers are with his family and friends as they mourn his tragic passing. https://t.co/7dM3sEqkp3
As well as @RepLaMalfa, @RepJacobs, @RepDLesko, @RepJeffDuncan, @repandybiggsaz, @RepFitzgerald, and @RepDonaldsPress.

Thank you to all of my colleagues for cosponsoring the National School Choice Week resolution, including @EdLaborGOP Leader @virginiafoxx, @RepRickAllen, @RepBurgessOwens, @RepWalberg, @RepDLamborn, @repdarrellissa, @RepJoeWilson, @RepGallagher, @RepRalphNorman, @RepHuizenga...

Last week, I spoke on the House floor about how parents have the right to be involved in the education of their children, and how school choice helps provide opportunities for students. #schoolchoice https://t.co/ZwH9MUGKUG

I have introduced a resolution to recognize this week as National School Choice Week! School choice is vital for Michigan parents, so their children can pursue the highest quality education available and the opportunities that are best for them. #schoolchoice https://t.co/kDI1Vuvdsv

This is deeply concerning for the rule of law in Honduras to say nothing of the significant impact it will have on our worsening border crisis. The United States must stand against it. https://t.co/UEjmCLI5ol

At a time when businesses are struggling with supply chain disruptions, labor shortages, and higher costs for gas and electricity, the last thing they need is the federal government burdening them with more costs and making it harder for them to retain and hire workers.

Even the White House knows its vaccine mandate is  a massive overreach. Don't forget that earlier this year, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said a vaccine mandate is not the role of the federal government. https://t.co/dsarwG9zPs

President Biden's vaccine mandate is a massive overreach. I have introduced the No Vaccine Mandate Act with 17 colleagues on @HouseAppropsGOP to block OSHA funding for enforcing this mandate. Thank you to @RepKayGranger, @TomColeOK04, & my committee colleagues for their support.

Today, I introduced the Veterans Patient Advocacy Act, with Rep. Debbie Dingell, Rep. Lisa McClain, and Rep. Elissa Slotkin. This bipartisan legislation will increase the number of patient advocates at VA facilities and I am proud to have support for it from the VFW & SVA. https://t.co/0GkzehyZd3

This pipeline provides vital energy to Michiganders, as well as people throughout the Midwest and Canada. Today’s illegal action, right before the winter heating season, shows how out-of-touch some groups are with the majority of Americans who want affordable and reliable energy.

This illegal assault on our nation’s energy infrastructure should be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. Everyone has the right to protest and demonstrate against ideas they disagree with, but there is no right to trespass and illegally tamper with infrastructure. https://t.co/3YMtuCvAJI

Paul always stood up for his beliefs, especially as the leader of the School Choice Caucus, and he worked hard to do what was right for Michigan families. I am heartbroken by Paul's passing and know he will be greatly missed.

Today, I mourn the loss of my friend and colleague Paul Mitchell, and I offer my condolences to his wife Sherry and their family. Paul and I competed against one another, but we also quickly became friends, and I will always be grateful for his friendship & service to our nation.

Congress should never allow the money of hardworking taxpayers to be used to end the lives of unborn children. We should continue to protect unborn children and keep the Hyde Amendment. #HydeSavesLives https://t.co/O0tMescRTU

Thank you for the nice meeting today, @michfoundations. We talked about my legislation to expand rural broadband, the BOOST Act, as well as other issues the foundations are working on to help our state. https://t.co/AtOPW3nfZh
Thank you so much for taking the time to meet with me today. It was nice to speak with you and talk about the issues facing our communities in the Fourth District. https://t.co/LKB1LEOOEB
Here is the press release on today's announcement with @RepCheri: https://t.co/nxUMmJ7Xct

Chemistry creates good-paying jobs for hundreds of thousands of Americans and it is crucial to ensuring our nation maintains its status as a world leader in research and innovation. Thank-you also to @AmChemistry @AmerChemSociety and @NACD_RD for working with the caucus.

Today, I welcomed @RepCheri as the new co-chair of the Congressional Chemistry Caucus. I look forward to working with her and our colleagues in the year ahead to talk about the importance of chemistry to the economy and more.

Congratulations to @WFP on being honored with the #NobelPeacePrize today! Because of the strong support from the United Sates, including @USAIDSavesLives and @USDAForeignAg, @WFP has played a part in reducing global hunger. https://t.co/ko1BYul3C3

Thank-you to Bette Brand and her team for coming to mid Michigan and meeting with community leaders these past two days about how USDA Rural Development can help our communities recover from the flooding earlier this year. https://t.co/A9xSNQOQl7

The May flooding has affected so many in our region. It’s a long process to get FEMA assistance and I know @realdonaldtrump wants to help the hardworking people of mid Michigan. I will be asking him today to expedite the disaster declaration and help us cut through the red tape.

I know many in our community want to hear directly from FEMA about what it can do to help our community. Regional Administrator James K. Joseph from @femaregion5 was here today and I have posted video of his message to the community on my Facebook page. https://t.co/cSLNaqeObm

Thank you to my colleagues for their support of our region. @SenStabenow @SenGaryPeters @RepDanKildee @RepFredUpton @RepHuizenga @RepWalberg @RepJackBergman @RepPaulMitchell @RepDebDingell @RepLawrence @RepRashida @RepAndyLevin @RepHaleyStevens @RepSlotkin
Thank you to @GovWhitmer for coming to Midland yesterday and for submitting the emergency request in the face of this historic flooding.

Thank you to @realDonaldTrump for his very quick approval of the emergency request for Michigan. I have been talking with FEMA & federal officials since Tuesday and they have been very supportive. I will be working with them in the days ahead to help Michigan families recover. https://t.co/XYaKGQzkiW
Saginaw County officials have released the following information for residents. https://t.co/CjMCF9ijJ6

Shelters for Midland County residents who need to evacuate have been set up at:
Coleman High School
Meridian Junior High
Midland Mall
West Midland Family Center
Bullock Creek High School
Messiah Lutheran Church
For current emergency information, please go to https://t.co/7GKt3oAty5
I have been working with state and local officials throughout the day, and tonight I opened communication with FEMA as we prepare to assess the need for future assistance.

Mid Michigan residents pull together in challenging times and we will make it through this. Right now, the most important priority is staying safe, and I urge everyone to follow the advice of emergency responders who are protecting our community.
We're on TV and online right now, and the second half-hour will be exclusively online. Hope you can join us for this important discussion. https://t.co/qsnU3aEMU8

After more than three decades of inaction from Washington, we got this project funded and construction is moving forward. Thanks to @realDonaldTrump, @RepJackBergman, @RepPaulMitchell and my bipartisan colleagues on the House Appropriations Committee for their support. https://t.co/DH9JtztfL9
Hope you will join @RepDanKildee and I tonight at 7 PM. https://t.co/OpKdCqTwtG
Hope you will tune in tomorrow for the virtual town hall with @RepDanKildee. https://t.co/DspyMOHSHX

A couple of weeks ago I did a virtual tour with @emergentbiosolu and learned how it is working to address the Coronavirus pandemic. With a facility in the Lansing area and more across the country, it's good to see teams working together for a cure. https://t.co/BnCHQZ3GQF
Thank you for visiting the office this week. It was good to see you! https://t.co/rbLK56SJnl
Congratulations on this outstanding award from Saginaw Future, and thank you for your work in the community. https://t.co/urMibAHpsL

- Reiterated his support for the Soo Locks. @POTUS signed legislation last month funding the construction of a new lock.
- Support for the Iraqi-Christian community in Michigan. This bipartisan concern has been a key priority for our state. It is not safe for Christians in Iraq.

We had a productive meeting on Air Force One and afterwards President Trump announced:
- Support for stopping Asian carp and invasive species from entering the Great Lakes.
- Support for an F-35 base at Selfridge Air National Guard Base.

Thank you for the ride back to Michigan, Mr. President! You promised to deliver a new trade deal with Mexico and Canada and you kept that promise. USMCA is a win for Michigan agriculture and manufacturing. @POTUS https://t.co/bMN2BT9OWS

It was wonderful to join you this morning for this briefing on rare cancers. In my three years on Appropriations there has been strong bipartisan support for more research and we have allocated record funding for the NIH. Thank you for the invitation to join you today! https://t.co/AKfjZikidu

Congratulations to the Democrats on last night's 14-7 victory. Dan and I were proud to represent @CMUniversity in the game! Since the Dems won, I will be getting Dan a BLT from Tony's in Birch Run. Maybe next year, the GOP will win and he will get me some coneys from Flint. https://t.co/UlJLXW32g4

Anastasia and her mother Natalie came to the ceremony to be honored with talented artists from across the country and Anastasia's artwork will be displayed in the Capitol for a year. Congratulations Anastasia!
It was wonderful to welcome Anastasia Tucker, winner of the Congressional Art Competition for the Fourth District, to the Capitol today. https://t.co/E4GkTkAMz6
Thank you for coming to the office today! It was nice to see you. I hope you enjoy the rest of your visit to Washington, D.C., and have safe travels back to our home state. https://t.co/5stXOWE6sK
This continues the strong economic record of the past couple of years, with unemployment at record lows, and Michigan residents keeping more of their own money, which is always a good thing.
Tax reform has spurred developments including today’s, as businesses across mid and northern Michigan build new facilities and create more good-paying jobs.

Terrific news for Beaverton today! The federal government is investing $1.45 million in the community's opportunity zone which was created by the tax reform law I supported in 2017. 
https://t.co/4nSVeFV5p3

SOO LOCKS FUNDING MOVES FORWARD: Today, the Appropriations Committee passed legislation with $75.3 million for building a new lock at the Soo Locks. This has been a top priority of my work on the committee and it funds the construction of a new lock for the first time in decades! https://t.co/ciA9M1WLT4

While I have concerns about other parts of this large bill, especially any that might affect Michigan agriculture, I am optimistic that by working with the president as we have done, strong support for the GLRI will continue as we move toward a final bill that is signed into law.

As a member of the Appropriations Committee, I have been working with my colleagues to build a strong bipartisan coalition of support for the GLRI including Republicans, Democrats, and President Trump. That is reflected in this new legislation which has full funding for the GLRI. https://t.co/VETJRjk8it

More good news for Michigan today. In its bill for next year, the House Appropriations Committee is fully funding the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative. This meets the level President Trump supported after meeting with me, @RepHuizenga and @RepJackBergman on March 28. https://t.co/DUs1HXM5RR

It's been outstanding to work with @RepJackBergman on this important project for our state. I know we've been talking to our colleagues and working hard to make sure this funding, as requested by @POTUS, is included. This is a big step forward. https://t.co/FkaoMTvO7J

On Monday, May 13, my office will be holding a resource fair for veterans and military personnel in the Fourth District. It will be at the Kochville Veterans Hall in Saginaw County from 2 PM to 4 PM. I look forward to seeing you there. https://t.co/IHwdCB9t8v

Thank you to Montcalm Community College for hosting this forum in Sidney.  I discussed the work I am doing on the Appropriations Committee to protect the Great Lakes, fund the Soo Locks, and much more. https://t.co/UaEzJ6G8hS

This includes the many dairy farmers in Michigan who have been hurt by Canada's unfair trade practices. We have the best farmers in the world and this new agreement will help them sell more Michigan-made products. Thank you for coming to Michigan, Mr. @VP.

I met with Vice President Pence this afternoon and we discussed important issues for Michigan including jobs and the economy. Michigan farmers will benefit from the new trade agreement the Administration has negotiated with Canada and Mexico. https://t.co/8D7BPoxYIy
Thank you for the invitation to see the work you and the students have been doing. It was outstanding! https://t.co/iKVK6s0I0t
Ashwin did a terrific job with his app! I look forward to seeing him at the Capitol in Washington D.C. next month. https://t.co/KucoynkSad

Thank you for the invitation to speak with your group today. https://t.co/AHTlseg5bG

I enjoyed meeting with @realdonaldtrump today. As a member of the Appropriations Committee, I will do everything I can to make sure the committee follows through on this commitment from @POTUS and help protect the Great Lakes for future generations. https://t.co/0luJ6YV38l

Thank you for coming to the office today. It was wonderful to see you and your group. I enjoyed our discussion about the important work Michigan foundations are doing in our communities. https://t.co/DXkzb01KFr

This is incredible news for Michigan! Since @RepJackBergman, @RepPaulMitchell and I talked to @POTUS about the Locks in April, there has been more progress on building a new Lock than has been made in decades. This new funding will benefit our state. https://t.co/4mNQOYi6qS

It was wonderful to see your group this morning and talk about my efforts in Congress to build a new lock at the Soo Locks, fund the GLRI, and stop Asian carp. The Great Lakes are vital to Michigan and we need to protect them for future generations. https://t.co/EuIM8BJ2Mu
Thank you, Dean Hendrick. It was nice to see you and to hear about the work MSU Extension is doing in our communities. https://t.co/A9k3mPQ2lu

John and Debbie have been wonderful friends, and while we mourn his passing, we also celebrate his extraordinary American life and his distinguished public service to the people of Michigan and the nation.

John Dingell was a dedicated public servant who was deeply committed to his principles, his constituents, the House of Representatives, his sports teams, and his beloved Debbie. As the longest serving member of Congress he was a part of historic moments for more than six decades. https://t.co/9CKJrmWnvi
We're glad you're on here! You and Debbie have our prayers and support. https://t.co/PtIep4fKFz
A wonderful guest for the State of the Union. God bless. #SOTU https://t.co/JSsRVLlVix

Today, @HouseAppropsGOP passed legislation increasing funding for the Highway Trust Fund by a billion dollars to $46 billion. This means more money for federal roads & I will continue to advocate for additional funding to fix our country's most important infrastructure needs.

Yesterday, @HouseAppropsGOP passed legislation funding FRIB at @michiganstateu. FRIB brings world-class research, talent, jobs and economic activity to mid Michigan. Also, thank you to @RepMikeBishop for his advocacy on this important project. https://t.co/PlaHHTygLG
Thank you! Looking forward to the game this year too! https://t.co/YcCgU0XvZe

President Trump and Ambassador Haley have used strong sanctions to bring North Korea to the negotiating table. Now sanctions can be used again to get a better deal with Iran and stop it from obtaining a nuclear weapon.

The nuclear deal gave Iran, the leading state-sponsor of terrorism, billions of dollars and it used that money to terrorize people around the world. Iran's aggression & hostility towards America & Israel is why I rejected this bad deal when Pres. Obama proposed it 3 years ago.

She raised an incredible family, including another president, and lived her life with humor, generosity and compassion for all she met each day. Amy and I join our nation in praying for President Bush and the entire Bush family as they mourn the loss of a wonderful woman.

Barbara Bush was an amazing woman. She was fiercely loyal, funny, witty, and plain-spoken. She was married to the love of her life for 73 years, and together they served our country with grace and class as President and First Lady. https://t.co/qokPkoxnUr
